body:
Follow-up from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23880#issuecomment-1078975886.

This stores the lazy serialized compact block message future for the last seen block, rather than a shared pointer to the compact block itself. Then we don't have to reserialize the message for any incoming CMPCTBLOCK messages from low-bandwidth peers.

It was mentioned there was a speed savings of 25% using this method for sending to high-bandwidth peers https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23880#issuecomment-1086043016. I've included benchmarks which seems to be an even higher speedup.

|               ns/op |                op/s |    err% |          ins/op |          cyc/op |    IPC |         bra/op |   miss% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------------:|----------------:|-------:|---------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|        1,226,686.00 |              815.20 |    0.8% |    4,405,458.00 |    1,521,312.00 |  2.896 |     973,385.00 |    0.2% |      0.01 | `SerializeNetMsg`

|               ns/op |                op/s |    err% |          ins/op |          cyc/op |    IPC |         bra/op |   miss% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------------:|----------------:|-------:|---------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|           36,905.33 |           27,096.35 |    0.4% |      110,607.50 |       81,512.00 |  1.357 |       4,165.00 |    0.1% |      0.00 | `CacheSerializeNetMsg`
title: p2p: cache compact block message to use for low bandwidth CMPCT_BLOCK
